Papirnati bolniški listi le še do konca januarja 2020
06 Nov 2019, 10:02 by Silva Križman, Sta

Izvajalci zdravstvenih storitev po celotni Sloveniji bodo v novembru in decembru začeli postopno izdajati elektronske bolniške liste. Zavod za zdravstveno zavarovanje Slovenije (ZZZS) uvaja elektronsko rešitev, ki bo omogočala postopno nadomestitev papirnatega obrazca, ki se bo s februarjem 2020 bolj ali manj poslovil.



Papirnati bolniški listi bodo kmalu le še zgodovina. 

SLOVENIJA > Obrazec o upravičeni zadržanosti z dela bodo med drugim še vedno tiskali za zaposlene pri fizičnih osebah in za zaposlene pri tujih organizacijah ter konzularnih in diplomatskih predstavništvih v Sloveniji, so pojasnili na ZZZS.
Pilotna uvedba elektronskega bolniškega lista, v kateri so sodelovali nekateri zdravstveni domovi in štirje zasebniki, se je začela 3. septembra. “Bila je izredno koristna, saj je bilo ugotovljenih več manjših pomanjkljivosti in napak, ki so bile odpravljene. To je omogočilo boljšo pripravo navodil in informacijskih rešitev, ki so sedaj pripravljene na nacionalno uvedbo,” so navedli na ZZZS.
Nacionalna uvedba elektronskega bolniškega lista bo tako potekala do konca leta, ko se morajo v sistem vključiti vsi zdravstveni izvajalci. V prehodnem obdobju do začetka februarja bodo zdravniki sicer še vedno izdajali tudi papirnati obrazec.
Od februarja bodo delodajalci morali za zaposlene za začasne zadržanosti od dela obvezno prevzemati elektronski bolniški list prek spletnega sistema SPOT (prej eVEM). Delodajalci bodo zato morali pravočasno prilagoditi svojo informacijsko opremo, pozivajo na ZZZS, ki bo predvidoma do novega leta za delodajalce pripravil informacijsko rešitev.
Na ZZZS so prepričani, da bo uvedba elektronskega bolniškega lista pomembno razbremenila družinske zdravnike. Pričakujejo namreč, da se bo s časom zmanjšalo število obiskov zavarovancev v ambulantah, saj jim zgolj zaradi pridobitve bolniškega lista ne bo treba obiskati zdravnika, če bo ta ocenil, da pregled ob zaključku bolniške odsotnosti ni potreben.
Do novosti so sicer nekoliko skeptični v zdravniških vrstah, saj ocenjujejo, da prinaša dodatne administrativne obremenitve za zdravnike.
Sicer pa naj bi uvedba elektronskih bolniških listov poenostavila tudi oddaje zahtevkov za refundacijo nadomestila plače na ZZZS. Vlogi namreč po novem ne bo treba prilagati originalnega ali skeniranega bolniškega lista, saj ga bo lahko delodajalec prevzel kadarkoli in tudi že pripravil zahtevek.

Paper-based sick leaves only until the end of January 2020
06 Nov 2019, 10:02 by Silva Krizman, Sta

Healthcare providers across Slovenia will begin gradually issuing electronic patient lists in November and December. The Health Insurance Institute of Slovenia (ZZZS) is introducing an electronic solution that will enable the gradual replacement of the paper form, which will more or less say goodbye to February 2020.



Paper sick leaves will soon be history.

SLOVENIA> The form of justified retention from work will still be printed for employees of natural persons and for employees of foreign organizations, consular posts and diplomatic missions in Slovenia, the HIIS explained.
The pilot introduction of an electronic sickness register, involving some health centers and four private individuals, began on September 3. "It has been extremely helpful as several minor flaws and bugs have been identified that have been fixed. This made it possible to better prepare instructions and information solutions that are now ready for national launch, ”they stated at the HIIS.
The national introduction of the electronic sick leave will thus be completed by the end of the year, when all healthcare providers have to join the system. In the transition period to the beginning of February, doctors will continue to issue a paper form.
Starting in February, employers will be required to temporarily retrieve an electronic sick leave form via the online SPOT system (formerly eVEM) for temporary abstinence employees. Employers will therefore have to adapt their IT equipment in a timely manner, they call on the HIIS, which is expected to prepare an information solution for employers by the new year.
At ZZZS they are convinced that the introduction of an electronic patient record will be a significant burden for family doctors. Namely, they expect that the number of visits to the outpatient clinics will decrease over time, since they will not only need to visit a doctor to obtain a sickness certificate if the latter assesses that a check is not necessary at the end of their sick leave.
However, they are somewhat skeptical of medical types, as they believe that they bring additional administrative burdens for doctors.
In addition, the introduction of electronic sick leaves would also simplify the submission of claims for reimbursement of salary compensation to the HIIS. Namely, the application will not need to be adjusted to the original or scanned sick leave, since the employer will be able to pick it up at any time and also prepare a claim.
